creator: seb@zurich.ibm.com
text:
Created attachment 31067
Stack trace of all the threads.

Hi all,

I am running a performance test aganist Apache 2.4.6 and
sometimes (especially when the load is high) some children crash.

The application is based on PHP (version 5.5.6).

I always get at least one of these crashes during my tests.
At a first glance the number of crashes seems related to the
incoming load (the higher the load, the larger the number).

The error log does not contain anything interesting other than

[Fri Nov 22 10:04:59.438322 2013] [core:notice] [pid 15220:tid 140231002367808] AH00051: child pid 15394 exit signal Segmentation fault (11), possible coredump in /tmp/

I configured Apache to save the dump and then with gdb I got
the stack trace of all the threads (the results is attached).

Feel free to ask me further information.

Thank you in advance for your support.
Regards
Sebastiano

creator: covener@gmail.com
text:
This is not something we can take as a bug, mod_php crashed in a threaded MPM.

"""
We do not recommend using a threaded MPM in production with Apache 2. Use the prefork MPM, which is the default MPM with Apache 2.0 and 2.2. For information on why, read the related FAQ entry on using Apache2 with a threaded MPM
"""

You should be using fastcgi. You might ask for help on a users list.
